article.headline: Montana State 61, Weber State 48
article.story: BOZEMAN, Mont. (AP) -- Jason Erickson scored 16 of his 22 points in the final 8:31 Thursday to lead Montana State to a 61-48 victory over Weber State, whose coach was serving a one-game suspension for comments he made about league officials. Montana State (10-6 overall, 2-1 Big Sky) opened the game with an 18-1 lead and Weber State (7-8, 0-2) didn't reach double figure scoring until Slobodan Ocokoljic hit two free throws to pull within 23-11 with 4:49 left in the half. Weber closed the half with an 18-11 run to trim the Bobcat lead to 29-19. The Bobcats opened the second half with another big run and took a 40-21 lead on two free throws by Matt Towsley with 12:43 remaining. The Wildcats could get no closer than 10 points twice in the final 10 minutes. Calvin Ento was the only other Bobcat in double figures with 14 points and six rebounds. Ocokoljic led the Wildcats with 13 points and nine rebounds, but he had 11 of the team's 31 turnovers -- both school records. Nic Sparrow added 11 points for the Wildcats. The win was MSU coach Mick Durham's 103rd Big Sky victory, putting the 14th-year Bobcat coach in first place for all-time league wins. Durham passed Bobby Dye who had 102 career conference victories. Weber State coach Joe Cravens was suspended for comments he made on a radio talk show Wednesday in which he questioned the "level of officiating" on the road and suggested some officials can be easily intimidated by home crowds. League rules prohibit coaches from publicly criticizing officials, and carry a mandatory one-game suspension and letter of reprimand.
